A disgraced noble turned mendicant, years of hardship have turned the Wretch into a walking plague. In combat, he revels in the spreading of blight, accumulating it on himself as he suffers hardship before unleashing his chittering horde to devastating effect. The Wretch is craven by nature, however, and can just as easily flee, or even put his allies in harm's way.

The Wretch wears little into battle, save for his tattered, once luxurious finery. His miserable appearance may be deceiving, however, as he is more than capable of defending himself, whether it be with the stiletto concealed within his cane, by commanding his legion of vermin, or even by spreading sickness with a mere touch.

When at rest, the Wretch is self sufficient, tending to his wounds with his own vile methods in lieu of visiting a sanitarium. His life as a beggar has taught him homemade remedies of dubious effectiveness, which he may impart on his allies. Given the opportunity, he may also search the area, combing through filth and offal in search of rare goods.
On the Mend
Suspicious Cure
Miasma
Rag and Bone
Didn't need that nail anyways.
Ah! Better already!
There's something satisfying about peeling 'em off.
I find if you pop 'em at this point it clears up in a day or two.
You like cat? ...Thigh or breast?
What, you don't appreciate my fine cuisine? Heh.
Something's got my pretties riled up. Wonder what...
Smell that? No? Good.
Odd sort of nip in the air. Invigorating, really. Don't you think?
Oh, there's some lovely filth down here!
Let me see what I can find around here...
You know what they say, right. One man's trash...
{colour_start|blight}Blight{colour_end} 1 pts/rd for 3 rds
Scavenge Loot
The Crooked Man

A rank odor heralds the arrival of a gangrel beggar. Wheezing, shivering, and drooling as he goes, this pauper bears an ill-favored look, helped little by the faint chittering sound that seems to accompany him...
Rats in the Walls

Calamity! A scampering legion of obscene vermin has descended on our hamlet, spreading pestilence and disease wherever they go. Citizens are advised to keep their food supplies under lock and chain until the outbreak subsides and its source is stamped out.
Huh. 'Bout bloody time.
Least I won't have to see you lot again.
You won't get rid of me that easily.
My veins are on fire!
I...feel...faint
My heart will burst!
It eats away at my flesh!
Antivenom! NOW!
My skin burns!
Ugh! It's flaring up again!
Not an unfamiliar feeling at this point.
Ah lovely. The itch is back.
Yes, by all means, I didn't need that skin anyways...
You there! Bring me the medicine!
Ugh, the rash...
Feast, my pretties! Feast!
Yes! Go for the eyes!
Nyeh heh heh!
Hahaha! Watch them squirm!
They all squeal once they have a few of my pretties on them.
Impressive, isn't it? How they burrow through flesh?
Ahh! The skin sloughs off my bones!
Bones! Walking bones!
I see my indiscretions, all laid bare...
Wh... what am I doing here?
No! I want to live!
I-I have so much left to live for!
G... get them away from me!
Don't hurt me! I'm a noble!
Even my pretties nip at my feet!
I knew one of you was on their side!
They know too much! The game is up!
You REEK of treachery!
You're with them, aren't you? Confess!
You bloody peasants!
All I see is food for my pretties!
Disgraceful. Can't even help a poor old beggar.
Freaks! Simpletons!
What do you know of suffering? Do you know how much I've lost?!
Fingernails? What fingernails?
Think I can't take it? Come on now! I'll rip you to bits!
Shred my skin! It'll grow back!
Give me your best shot. Falling to bits anyway.
Just a bit of blood. Coughed up more than that before.
Alms for a poor old beggar? Heh.
You are ALL of you beneath me!
Cough it up! I have hundreds of mouths to feed!
Equal shares! We demand equal shares!
Save me! I'm dying of poverty!
All my riches, all for naught...
What's it all for in the end.
We're all going to be worms sooner or later...
I wonder if they'll eat me when I'm gone. Least I'll have been good for something.
Should've just curled up and died...
What's that smell? The blood, it sings to me...
Ahh, the perspiration! The nausea!
I shed my skin and leave it for the homeless to sleep in!
Gods... the stench of it all... Intoxicating...
Heeheeheeheeheeee!
Not today.
Feh. I didn't come this far to die to you lot.
My pretties outnumber them a hundred to one!
What, you're scared of these louts? Jog on.
Aha! My pretties have the way of it!
Follow my pretties! They smell blood!
Look at my pretties go! Ahahahahahahaha!!
There's always more to the corner beggar than meets the eye...
Pfah. I've come this far, haven't I?
Hahaha. What more can they do to me?
Just cause I've lost a toe or two doesn't mean I'm falling apart just yet.
Not done living yet.
What, giving up so soon? Not on my watch.
Come on then! We've got this!
Go on. Get in there or I'll feed you to my pretties.
Hear that? It's their heart. Go for it!
Come on now. A one and a two and a...
What, don't tell me you're scared of this lot.
Gods, this scab is a pest...
Just a little nibble... Ah, there we are!
M-my pretties look so hungry...
Don't let them kill me!
*nervous fingernail chewing*
You're no better than the rats that follow me!
I know the stench of a traitor a mile away!
Bloody turncoats, the lot of you!
Lance the boils! Bleed the sores!
Rip me to bits! I can take it!
Anything to stop this blasted itching!
Didn't think it was possible to stoop lower than me, yet somehow you lot pulled it off.
Do you know how quickly a rat can burrow through a human stomach?
I'll leave you all in the gutter if I have to!
You all count for one. I count for hundreds.
Defiled I may be, but I am still above you all. Never forget that.
Not a single coin to give to charity? For shame!
Worthless. Worthless and alone.
I had it all, and lost it all...
Look at me. I'm already a corpse...
Feed me a stray cat!
Eyes, lungs, pancreas... Mmm...
There was a crooked man, who walked a crooked mile...
Away! Away!
Beast! A foul beast!
RUN!
You're so brave, why don't you go first? Eh?
Out of my way, you louts!
Get out of my face!
Come on then! Have at you!
Come closer! Let's see what you're made of!
Come get some, you louts!
Make way for the beggar king and his subjects!
That smell... That piquant smell...
Have you seen my flute?
I think I left my flute over here...
My work here is done!
I think this is the way to Hamelin...
Let me have this. Let me do something right.
Dead man walking.
Get away. You'll catch it too.
It's better this way.
I... just need a moment...
It's for the best if I disappear.
Ugh! Do I have to do it all myself?
Make way, serfs!
My pretties need space! Move!
Deal with it yourselves!
You! Get out of my way!
Don't touch me, peasant! Don't you know who I am?
I-I can't! I won't!
Please, spare me!
O Light, deliver this humble servant...
Because your orders have been SO good so far.
I trust you as much as my pretties would trust a bloody cat.
Pfft. No.
You don't give the orders around here, worm.
I have better things to do.
Why should I listen to you?
What's the point.
Dead men can't act.
They... they won't let me...
Actually, we're an anarcho-syndicalist commune...
The king of rats is the one that makes the rules!
But the emperor isn't wearing any clothes!
And I suppose you have a better idea!
You're just going to get us all killed or worse. Ugh. Stand aside.
I can do this. I can do this.
Here! This'll stop the itch!
Whoops, there goes another toe.
Stop me if you've heard this one before:
Because I can, that's why.
I'm probably the only one that knows what they're doing.
Shut up. This is going to work.
Don't question my plans, you sod.
Well of course it doesn't make sense to YOU.
Watch! My pretties have the way of it!
Whatever.
Let's just move on already.
I AM AN ALTERED BEAST!
Your king commands you!
Somebody stop me!
I can hear them... Skulking just out of view...
That chittering... It's not one of mine...
Wh-what are those tiny pinpoints of light over there?
What could really prevent my pretties from turning on us all? They're awfully hungry...
My pretties will be the only company I keep tonight.
Gods... My pretties look hungry...
Ugh. Never smelt pus like that before.
Gods, this skin just won't come OFF...
Ugh. Pass me that toenail, would you.
Did you know it only takes a starving rat about 30 seconds to burrow through a human stomach? Food for thought.
Gods, you're an ugly one. And that's coming from me.
And here I thought I couldn't fall any further. Yet here I am with you lot.
Might I remind you that as a noble, I am owed double.
I'll be collecting donations later. They're for a good cause, believe me.
Give me that. My pretties need it more than you do.
In a manner of speaking I'm dead.
Best if you go on without me. I'll just spread it to you all.
What have I become?...
Bring out your dead!
Why, you all look so plump and ripe...
Just a taste of that wound of yours? ...No?
Come on then! I can take it!
Right in the boil, if you please.
Do it. DO IT.
Just put me out of my misery.
My body for my subjects!
Carve me up and serve me to my pretties! With an apple in the mouth, if you please.
You're one of THEM!
You liar! You Judas!
You're only good as food for my pretties!
Sic 'em girls! Sic 'em!
Oh... Your wounds smell lovely...
Your scars... I... I must...
This bloody tooth just won't come out already...
Blasted scalp keeps itching and itching! AGH!
Here, my pretties. Come have your dinner.
Such is life.
My pretties are starving for more!
Here! Take it! Take it all!
Out of the frying pan and into the fire, eh?
You bloody coward.
End of the road, I reckon.
Who are you trying to fool? We can't win this one.
Not yet. Almost got 'em.
J-Just a while longer! Please!
*tittering*
Just tea, thank you!
No! Not like this!
Back! Back I say!
You let that happen!
I thought you had my back!
Gah! Protect me, you worthless oafs!
You're supposed to be guarding ME!
Just a tooth. Got a few more left.
Ah, finally, the itching stopped...
Skreeeee! Skreeeee!!
The pus flows again! Huzzah!
They're playing with us!
They toy with us like cats with mice!
Hmph. Not today.
Can't get rid of me that easily.
Just hit me and stop this blasted itch!
Shame. Was hoping it'd lance the boil for me.
GIVE ME A TASTE OF IT!
Neener neener!
Not bad, for a peasant.
Am I supposed to be impressed?
Better than nothing. Not by much though.
Mediocre.
FRESH PULSATING ORGANS!...
*boggling and bruxing*
There's too many of them!
They're too fast! Run!
Convenient.
How could you miss! They were a foot in front of you!
Worthless, incompetent, miserable CRETIN!
I don't know what else I expected.
Typical.
Good for nothing lout! What are they paying you for?
But my children will starve!
In the end we're all meat...
D-don't let them kill me!
It can't end here! I-it can't!
Playing the long con, are you.
Still standing? Blast.
Should've been me. Would've dulled the itch.
Ahh, the blood...
Good. Saves my pretties the trouble.
Just hope you don't give my pretties indigestion.
How come they get more worms than I do?
Oh, that looks delicious...
Gods, it was close... too close...
They are predators! Playing with their meals!
All a front.
Who do you think you two are fooling? Eh?
Please! Have some pity! I'm starving!
One hundred lashes for your incompetence!
N-no! I can't!
Where do you think you're going?
What, retreating already?
Imbecile.
But the emperor is wearing nothing at all!
That's arsenic isn't it?
Gimme a scalpel instead. Or some tweezers.
What for?
This is dead. DEAD.
Wouldn't trust you to tend my sores if you were the last one on earth.
Doctors recommend bloodletting sometimes, you know.
I don't want to. It's useless.
You'd deny my babies their milk?
Get your hands off me!
I can do it myself.
You're wasting your time.
Only if you apologize for not treating me by my proper titles!
Th-they will hear! They will see!
I-it won't work!
Not again! Never again!
Anything to finally be rid of me, eh?
What, am I not appealing enough to you?
Don't give my pretties that look, you ungrateful sod.
Bring me filleting knife!
Ah, such a rush...
Gods, this pus smells awful...
And what have you done to deserve help?
You slime. You don't deserve my help.
It'd be wasted on this lot.
Ugh, my legs will give way...
I have some sores to see to first.
Why should I waste my valuable time on such trivial errands?
Why bother?
Curse... this is a damn curse...
Can't you see? We're finished.
Just one tiny finger for my babies is all I ask.
Oh look, they like my scabs!
Bow before your king! Bow, you swine!
Don't touch me.
Get away from my pretties!
What're you hiding in your grubby little pockets?
It'll heal on its own. I think.
What, this? It's just a flesh wound.
Save your efforts, it'll go away on its own.
You'd just make it even worse, knowing you.
Wouldn't let you try and help me at knifepoint.
You make me sick. And that's saying a lot.
Don't touch me. You'll get sick too.
I'm not worth the effort.
Just snuff the fire out already, would you.
Sire, the peasants are revolting!
Just a tiny nibble? Please?
Not enough mold on it for my liking.
I know poison when I see it.
It's laced with cyanide. I can tell.
Nah, I'm on a diet.
I find fasting helps it heal quicker.
Don't. I'll just contaminate it.
Tastes like ash.
That's not a cat.
I have the strangest craving for cheese and hearts...
Not allowed in there. Can't imagine why.
They won't let me in. What did I do?
They don't take kindly to my pretties in there.

A disgraced noble turned mendicant, years of hardship have turned the Wretch into a walking plague. In combat, he revels in the spreading of blight, accumulating it on himself as he suffers hardship before unleashing his chittering horde to devastating effect. The Wretch is craven by nature, however, and can just as easily flee, or even put his allies in harm's way.

The Wretch wears little into battle, save for his tattered, once luxurious finery. His miserable appearance may be deceiving, however, as he is more than capable of defending himself, whether it be with the stiletto concealed within his cane, by commanding his legion of vermin, or even by spreading sickness with a mere touch.

When at rest, the Wretch is self sufficient, tending to his wounds with his own vile methods in lieu of visiting a sanitarium. His life as a beggar has taught him homemade remedies of dubious effectiveness, which he may impart on his allies. Given the opportunity, he may also search the area, combing through filth and offal in search of rare goods.
On the Mend
Suspicious Cure

A disgraced noble turned mendicant, years of hardship have turned the Wretch into a walking plague. In combat, he revels in the spreading of blight, accumulating it on himself as he suffers hardship before unleashing his chittering horde to devastating effect. The Wretch is craven by nature, however, and can just as easily flee, or even put his allies in harm's way.

The Wretch wears little into battle, save for his tattered, once luxurious finery. His miserable appearance may be deceiving, however, as he is more than capable of defending himself, whether it be with the stiletto concealed within his cane, by commanding his legion of vermin, or even by spreading sickness with a mere touch.

When at rest, the Wretch is self sufficient, tending to his wounds with his own vile methods in lieu of visiting a sanitarium. His life as a beggar has taught him homemade remedies of dubious effectiveness, which he may impart on his allies. Given the opportunity, he may also search the area, combing through filth and offal in search of rare goods.
On the Mend
Suspicious Cure

A disgraced noble turned mendicant, years of hardship have turned the Wretch into a walking plague. In combat, he revels in the spreading of blight, accumulating it on himself as he suffers hardship before unleashing his chittering horde to devastating effect. The Wretch is craven by nature, however, and can just as easily flee, or even put his allies in harm's way.

The Wretch wears little into battle, save for his tattered, once luxurious finery. His miserable appearance may be deceiving, however, as he is more than capable of defending himself, whether it be with the stiletto concealed within his cane, by commanding his legion of vermin, or even by spreading sickness with a mere touch.

When at rest, the Wretch is self sufficient, tending to his wounds with his own vile methods in lieu of visiting a sanitarium. His life as a beggar has taught him homemade remedies of dubious effectiveness, which he may impart on his allies. Given the opportunity, he may also search the area, combing through filth and offal in search of rare goods.

A disgraced noble turned mendicant, years of hardship have turned the Wretch into a walking plague. In combat, he revels in the spreading of blight, accumulating it on himself as he suffers hardship before unleashing his chittering horde to devastating effect. The Wretch is craven by nature, however, and can just as easily flee, or even put his allies in harm's way.

The Wretch wears little into battle, save for his tattered, once luxurious finery. His miserable appearance may be deceiving, however, as he is more than capable of defending himself, whether it be with the stiletto concealed within his cane, by commanding his legion of vermin, or even by spreading sickness with a mere touch.

When at rest, the Wretch is self sufficient, tending to his wounds with his own vile methods in lieu of visiting a sanitarium. His life as a beggar has taught him homemade remedies of dubious effectiveness, which he may impart on his allies. Given the opportunity, he may also search the area, combing through filth and offal in search of rare goods.

A disgraced noble turned mendicant, years of hardship have turned the Wretch into a walking plague. In combat, he revels in the spreading of blight, accumulating it on himself as he suffers hardship before unleashing his chittering horde to devastating effect. The Wretch is craven by nature, however, and can just as easily flee, or even put his allies in harm's way.

The Wretch wears little into battle, save for his tattered, once luxurious finery. His miserable appearance may be deceiving, however, as he is more than capable of defending himself, whether it be with the stiletto concealed within his cane, by commanding his legion of vermin, or even by spreading sickness with a mere touch.

When at rest, the Wretch is self sufficient, tending to his wounds with his own vile methods in lieu of visiting a sanitarium. His life as a beggar has taught him homemade remedies of dubious effectiveness, which he may impart on his allies. Given the opportunity, he may also search the area, combing through filth and offal in search of rare goods.
On the Mend

A disgraced noble turned mendicant, years of hardship have turned the Wretch into a walking plague. In combat, he revels in the spreading of blight, accumulating it on himself as he suffers hardship before unleashing his chittering horde to devastating effect. The Wretch is craven by nature, however, and can just as easily flee, or even put his allies in harm's way.

The Wretch wears little into battle, save for his tattered, once luxurious finery. His miserable appearance may be deceiving, however, as he is more than capable of defending himself, whether it be with the stiletto concealed within his cane, by commanding his legion of vermin, or even by spreading sickness with a mere touch.

When at rest, the Wretch is self sufficient, tending to his wounds with his own vile methods in lieu of visiting a sanitarium. His life as a beggar has taught him homemade remedies of dubious effectiveness, which he may impart on his allies. Given the opportunity, he may also search the area, combing through filth and offal in search of rare goods.
On the Mend
Suspicious Cure
Miasma
Rag and Bone

A rank odor heralds the arrival of a gangrel beggar. Wheezing, shivering, and drooling as he goes, this pauper bears an ill-favored look, helped little by the faint chittering sound that seems to accompany him...
Rats in the Walls

Calamity! A scampering legion of obscene vermin has descended on our hamlet, spreading pestilence and disease wherever they go. Citizens are advised to keep their food supplies under lock and chain until the outbreak subsides and its source is stamped out.
